page.title: 14Employment - Kennoway
page.content: In the past Kennoway was a centre for the production of{linen}cloth and of{ {leather shoes.}Many people were, therefore, kept in full-time employment within the boundaries of the village. Today, however, the story is very different. The traditional industries have long since gone and no new industry has replaced them. All that can be offered are a limited number of jobs within the service industries that do, naturally, exist in any community. Most people have to travel to near-by towns to work and, in some cases, to much further afield. Statistically, no figures are available for Kennoway alone with regard to unemployment, but for the Levenmouth area (including Kennoway) the figures show a rise from 12.9% in May 1981 to 20.9% in May 1985.
